intro: Thyrsodium salzmannianum, commonly known as Salzmann's thrysoideae, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters called thyrses. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
